nodes.bodyText:
You don't need a table to create a view. You can simply have:
CREATE VIEW test_table_authorization.bar AS SELECT current_user

This is nice because when you change the owner the value returned should change.
Also add tests when SECURITY is set to INVOKER (default is SECURITY OWNER), then changing owner should not change the returned value.
Don't we want to make separate tests for such cases?

I understand that for these scenarios the implementations simply checks for access for table, so putting these assertions here works, but It's something that requires the knowledge of the actual implementation to understand this test and therefore I would see it rather as a separate test. Not crucial, but think about it.
this is really unreadable to cope with bar and foo. I need to check couple times what is what when trying to understand error messages below.
Having assertUpdate(admin, "CREATE VIEW test_view_authorization.bar AS SELECT current_user AS user"); would not decrease the coverage, but surely would simplify the test.
Please add a test with hive view (where views is defined in Hive).
There is missing assertion that would prove that authorization was actually set. Below line could pass from other reasons too.
I guess this belongs to different commit.

Update commit message to:
Extract SetAuthorizationStatement class

commit.message: Add support for ALTER VIEW SET AUTHORIZATION
Add product tests for changing owner of view in hive

afterCommit.message: Add product tests for changing owner of view in hive
